timeline.message:
feat: Outline view support

Signed-off-by: Anton Grigorev <anton.grigorev@broadcom.com>

timeline.bodyText: no need this null init.
timeline.author: asatklichov

replies.bodyText: It needs to be here because of Lombok magic. We use Lombok for this class and that means no default initialization.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: name.strip() is unicode aware on whitespaces
timeline.author: asatklichov

replies.bodyText: You are right, but I realize that I don't need to do it here. Antlr did all the job.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: name.strip()
timeline.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: List.of()
timeline.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: These divisions are good candidates to be reused, would be better to define them either const or enum "PROCEDURE DIVISION", "ENVIRONMENT DIVISION", "DATA DIVISION"
timeline.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: Same, const/enum for SECTIONs (6 of them), like didvisions
timeline.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: List.of()
timeline.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: is getAnalysisResult() safe for NPE ?
timeline.author: asatklichov

replies.bodyText: Good question. Looks like we never put the null as analysisResult value. Usually, in the rest of the code, no one checks for null.
replies.author: grianbrcom

replies.bodyText: It is safe, but we have an unused constructor that may allow injecting a null AnalysisResult. it should be deleted by another PR
replies.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: consturctor with nulls, ... better define explicit default constructor.
timeline.author: asatklichov

timeline.bodyText: consturctor with nulls, ... better define explicit default constructor.
timeline.author: asatklichov

replies.bodyText: Maybe, even provide a builder
replies.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: I think you may remove this line, the stack will be printed on the next one
timeline.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: In this case, you will create a new service on each request, isn't it too expensive?
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: Renamed it into OutlineTask. Now it feels good.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: The action message here should be human-readable, something like "symbol analysis"
timeline.author: temanbrcom
temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText:
Maybe, if you add a ThreadLocal with CompletableFuture that will be waiting for the analysis result, you won't need this complicated structure. You may complete this future in notifyAnalysisFinished.
In this case, you will send the response only when analysis finished, even if you receive the request too early
timeline.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText:
You may define it as a use-case test and simplify the preparation for it.
Also, using DI in tests is a bad practice, so it would be better to avoid as much as we can.
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: The test now is based on UseCaseUtils.

timeline.bodyText: You may just put it in ifPresent()
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: Yes, make sense.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: I think you don't really need this assignment, you may trim the name directly on the next line, the same for some of the following cases
timeline.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Missing header! (in multiple places!)
timeline.author: zacanbrcom
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+package com.ca.lsp.core.cobol.semantics.outline;
+
+public enum NodeType {
+  PROGRAM,
+  PROGRAM_ID,
+  DIVISION,
+  SECTION,
+  STRUCT,
+  REDEFINES,
+  FIELD,
+  FIELD_66,
+  FIELD_88,
+  COPYBOOK,
+  PROCEDURE,
+  PROCEDURE_SECTION,
+  FILE
+}

replies.bodyText: And a clear description about that enum
replies.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: optional: we could extract the number associated with the enum field 66, ... since will never change
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: I would suggest a more clear name that reflect the check in a range
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Would be better to rename this method since what is doing at this level is to add a new node. the inner private method will be responsible to put that node at the right level
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText:
optional: it's super cool but I am afraid that will be a bit complicated for the developer understand what is going on here,
maybe extract the last  part ( hasRedefines ? NodeType.REDEFINES : NodeType.STRUCT) may help
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

replies.bodyText: I tried to improve this part by comments. Is it good now?
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Any plan to test also some negative scenarios?
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

replies.bodyText: The negative scenarios are here. It is a parameterized test and it includes positive and negative results.
replies.author: grianbrcom

replies.bodyText: got it!
replies.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: You can think a better name for that test! ;)
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: extract this in a separate method will made your test much easier to read..
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: which is the benefit to use the google.io library instead of use the built-in NIO?
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

replies.author: grianbrcom
zacanbrcom

replies.bodyText: Yeah, you are right. But it since the very beginning and still here... OK than.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText:
If I understood correctly looks like you used iteration and recursion in the same method.
I would prefer to separate the complexity for create the structure from the visiting and assert
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

replies.bodyText: I've split it into two methods for a list of nodes check and for each node check.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: There are some unused imports
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: not sure if might create strange results but I would recommend to use an empty outline object rather than a null reference
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: I will suggest to don't ignore it until we can still use socket communication (for developer purposes)
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

replies.bodyText: Oops...
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: please add a brief explanation of the purpose
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: might be better to wrap it in a method to improve readability
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

replies.bodyText:
I decided to keep them in one place because it easy to understand how the outline structure must be converted into a document symbol. Like: "first" DIVISION from outline node became "first" Method as a document symbol.
Or from(2, 2) for the "first" must become from(1, 2).
If I split the code by methods it will be hard to visually compare these two formats.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: can be renamed as Cursor?
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

timeline.message:
feat: Outline view support #481

Signed-off-by: Anton Grigorev <anton.grigorev@broadcom.com>

timeline.bodyText: I don't really like that the task is required to retrieve some data itself because it violates the purity principle. I will accept it now, but I feel like it might be improved later.
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: I've rewritten the logic here, probably, you will like it more.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Missing javadoc for test class
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: No test - no documentation. Easy!
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: Please, add a javadoc here
timeline.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: I am not really sure about the legal headers for test data, so I prefer to include them into the test class as String constant
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: Well, the String constant will be not so beautiful with pluses and new line symbols. OK.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: May it be something like "VariableNode" not to have name interferences
timeline.author: temanbrcom

timeline.bodyText: In this case, the positions will be null if the rule is adjacent to a copybook. I would recommend a filtration for tokens by channel 0 - they are guaranteed to present in the mapping.  The tokens might be taken from the BufferedTokenStream by the source interval
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText:
There is another restriction in the Outline view. We must show things that belong only to the opened program file.
IDE can't navigate the user to another file from the Outline view. There is no way to open a copybook when the user clicks on some Outline view element. The main idea of that behavior is hiding things that came from copybooks.
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.bodyText: looks like this class is no longer used
timeline.author: zacanbrcom

replies.bodyText: Oops. You are right. I deleted the whole test to be sure =)
replies.author: grianbrcom

timeline.message:
feat: Outline view support #481

Signed-off-by: Anton Grigorev <anton.grigorev@broadcom.com>

timeline.bodyText: Will it work if we receive this request two times for one analysis? I.e. when we receive didOpen and outline, then didChange and outline again, but at the time when the didChange has not put the new feature to the map?
timeline.author: temanbrcom

replies.bodyText: I think since the didChange is doing his stuff on the client side there is the "old" version of the outline view that should be replaced on the client (I am testing that behavior)
replies.author: zacanbrcom
grianbrcom
